projects.title: PE2 – Holidaze
projects.description: This school project at Noroff involved creating a venue booking platform. Users can register, log in/out, search for venues, make bookings, and manage profiles. The site is designed with usability and responsiveness in mind.

projects.title: SE2 – Auction House
projects.description: This was a semester exam project at Noroff. I built a fully functional auction house platform where users can create listings, place bids, and manage profiles. The site connects to Noroff’s official API to fetch and submit data in real time.

projects.title: JS Frameworks CA – E-commerce Website
projects.description: A Noroff course assignment where I developed a simple e-commerce website. Users can browse products, add and remove them from a shopping cart, and submit orders through a static checkout process. The site includes a functional contact form.

projects.title: Ruv Fotball
projects.description: I was contacted by the board to create a simple supporter team webpage. The goal was to showcase images, display static text, and allow users to join the club. I built a clean and responsive single-page application using React, with all content hardcoded due to the lack of API integration.

projects.title: JS Arctic Sailing
projects.description: This project was built for a small business owner who had a clear idea of the website layout and UI. I developed the site entirely in Visual Studio Code using React, implementing his UX design and ensuring mobile responsiveness. All content is manually added.

projects.title: Tranquility – Bachelor's Thesis
projects.description: My bachelor’s thesis at Oslo Metropolitan University (2020) was a clothing collection called 'Tranquility'. Inspired by nature (and the pandemic), it combined luxurious comfort with natural fibers like silk and wool to create a line suitable for elegant relaxation at home.

projects.title: Oslo Mitten
projects.description: A traditional Selbu mitten design created for Oslo Mikrospinneri. The mitten features a stylized 'O' in the hand to represent Oslo, combining classic Norwegian patterning with modern identity.

projects.title: Perleull
projects.description: A part off my job for Oslo Mikrospinneri was to co-create a new yarn called Perleull. This yarn is a blend of Norwegian wool and silk, designed to be soft, warm, and suitable for various knitting projects. It its the yarn used for the Oslo Mitten.
